citations.narrative:
The facility has an exercise program that was approved by the previous attending veterinarian, however the new
attending veterinarian has not approved the written exercise program. An exercise program that is approved by the
attending veterinarian helps ensure dogs are getting adequate space and exercise. Ensure that the exercise plan is
approved by the current attending veterinarian.

The new written program of veterinary care lists de-worming products that the facility uses, however does not have a
schedule of de-worming for adult dogs that is determined by the attending veterinarian (AV). I described what the facility
currently does to the AV who suggested it might need some changes or closer review. De-worming on a schedule that is
approved by the AV is important to be sure adequate parasite prevention is being given. The facility must obtain and
follow a de-worming schedule that is approved by the attending veterinarian.
This is a Re-License Inspection for a Class A license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) by 12/31/2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and
must wait 6 months to reapply.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
n

narrative:
3.8 
   
Exercise for dogs. 
The facility has an exercise program that was approved by the previous attending veterinarian, however the new 
attending veterinarian has not approved the written exercise program. An exercise program that is approved by the 
attending veterinarian helps ensure dogs are getting adequate space and exercise. Ensure that the exercise plan is 
approved by the current attending veterinarian. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The new written program of veterinary care lists de-worming products that the facility uses, however does not have a 
schedule of de-worming for adult dogs that is determined by the attending veterinarian (AV). I described what the facility 
currently does to the AV who suggested it might need some changes or closer review. De-worming on a schedule that is 
approved by the AV is important to be sure adequate parasite prevention is being given. The facility must obtain and 
follow a de-worming schedule that is approved by the attending veterinarian. 
 
This is a Re-License Inspection for a Class A license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) by 12/31/2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and 
must wait 6 months to reapply.  
 
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
 n
